subject: Automobile Racing
Accidents and Safety
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Nascar placed the drivers Kurt Busch and Tony Stewart on probation for six races Tuesday, beginning with the Daytona 500. The punishment resulted from a confrontation between the two after a wreck in practice last week.Nascar officials came into this season saying that drivers would be given more latitude to show emotion this year, and the relatively light nature of Tuesday’s punishments would seem to support that.No one would confirm that Stewart punched Busch at a meeting with officials, but Robin Pemberton, Nascar’s vice president for competition, said that how they conducted themselves after the accident, “from there through the rest of the evening, is why the penalties were equal.”But the Nascar spokesman Ramsey Poston noted, “If you are on probation for an altercation with another driver, and you have a second incident during that probation period, we are going to take action.”.
